A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
All the "bold" decisions made in this movie -- including from the character assissination of Luke Sywalker and the actual unceremonious assassination of Snoke -- might have worked just fine if the movie wasn't just objectively bad. 

It incorporated some of the worst aspects of the prequels\, featured one-dimensional\, mostly uninspiring and uninsteresting characters from both sides\, a completely nonsensical and pointless story\, and had me sitting in the theater actively disliking or cringing during just about every scene.

Oh well\, I told myself I would stop caring after TFA\, but now I truly don't\, so that's freeing to some degree at least. It's over\, and that's really a shame. Just another reminder that everything you once loved will either die or become a perverse version of itself\, and then you will die.
